title: what is true about utility maximizing consumers

content.question: Assume the price of a candy bar is $2 and the price of a bag of chips is $3. Assume Lilly’s marginal utility from consuming an additional candy bar is 10 utils and her marginal utility from consuming an additional bag of chips is 12 utils. If Lilly is spending her fixed weekly allowance on candy bars and bags of chips, which of the following actions will maximize Lilly’s total utility?

choices.label: Buying more candy bars and bags of chips
Buying more candy bars and fewer bags of chips
Buying fewer candy bars and more bags of chips
Buying fewer candy bars and bags of chips
Buying the same number of candy bars and bags of chips

content.answer: Buying more candy bars and fewer bags of chips
